posts.post_content:
Have three T202 Triple Folders.  All three are detached, so making that clear up front.  The three are:

Center Panel:  Lobert Almost Caught (red ink)  Ends:  Bridwell and Kling  Really nice condition, no creases, each would grade Ex or so.

Center Panel:  The Athletic Infield (red ink) Ends:  Thomas and Krause  Nice shape- center panel is solid EX, Thomas has small scratches on front of card, the Krause is Ex condition.

Center Panel:  The Athletic Infield (black ink)  Ends:  Konetchy and Hauser.  Center is creased in the middle where it was folded.  Konetchy is creased down the left edge, the Hauser is VG or so.  

Also have several individual panels,  center panels Tom Jones at Bat and Just Before the Battle (both in red ink).  End panels:  Including Grant, Suggs, Dahlen, Fletcher, Latham, Kling, Payne, and Meyers (trimmed) all in red ink.

Charles Wagner, Gaspar, Magee, McLean, Meyers, Wiltse (trimmed), Turner, Murphy, Harry Lord, Briscoe Lord, Murray, McDonnell,  Ford, Dahlen, Hoblitzel, Wilson, Elberfeld, Reulbach, Camnitz  all in black ink

Let me know if interested in any of these.  Condition runs from Ex/NM down to Fair.

[quote name="Chris Counts" post=1912334]Can you post some scans?[/QUOTE]

Here is link to some of them  [url]http://www.net54baseball.com/album.php?albumid=1202[/url]
Still available.  Any interest in T202?
I sent an email about the singles of Grant and Fletcher, but never heard back. It might be Net54's messaging system, which has failed me before. Can you post prices?
Great deals on the Triple Folders
I've had several inquiries but still available as of now.  Prices range from $10 down to a couple of bucks.  PM me if any interest
Any interest from the vintage and pre-war guys out there?  Great prices compared to any T202 that is still attached
